title: Mark Hughes hints West Brom intentionally leaked Saido Berahino’s drug ban before Stoke clash
text:
Comments MARK HUGHES revealed his fury with West Brom and Tony Pulis. 
The Stoke boss feels the Baggies leaked news of Saido Berahino’s drugs ban just 24 hours before he faced his former club. Getty Images 7 Mark Hughes has accused Baggies of leaking Saido Berahino’s drug ban 
He said: “They were able to keep it under wraps discreetly for six or seven months and lo and behold, just before a game against his new club, it comes out. Keep up to date with ALL the Stoke news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
“It is shame because people would suggest West Brom had something to do with that… 
“That would be an unfair thing to happen, wouldn’t it? 
“I could get myself into trouble.” 
Hughes is still seething that West Brom failed to tell Stoke about Berahino’s drugs problem at the start of negotiations over his £12million transfer last month — despite Potters boss Pulis’ claim his club were “open and honest”. PA:Press Association The Stoke boss hinted West Brom intentionally leaked it before their match West Brom 1-0 Stoke City : James Morrison early strike is enough to clinch three points Getty Images Berahino has already served his eight-game ban for recreational drug use PA:Press Association 7 Berahino lined up against his former side on his second Stoke appearance 
And Welshman Hughes also had a dig at Pulis for failing to shake hands before or after yesterday’s game, which West Brom won 1-0. 
Berahino, 23, failed to make an impact as a 58th-minute substitution and Hughes is still angry they discovered about the player’s problems from his advisors. 
Hughes added: “We weren’t told by West Brom about it, in fairness. Not at all. 
“There was talk West Brom had made us fully aware but they didn’t. We knew the situation anyway. We told them we knew.” Getty Images 7 Hughes insists West Brom did not clearly inform Stoke about the ban 
Pulis refused to talk to the media after a tetchy game, which saw Hawthorns stewards forced to separate warring rival fans. 
Hughes added: “I didn’t see him to shake hands. I was on the touchline some time at the end. 
“He didn’t shake my hand before the game, either. 
“I would have thought he might have come and welcomed me but for some reason he didn’t want to. 
“Maybe he does not like shaking hands. With most managers you have disagreements during games but usually after you have a beer. “You’ve picked up on a non-handshake but I’m not too upset.” 
James Morrison’s sixth-minute strike won it for the Baggies — but Berahino had just four touches and was booed throughout. 
Hughes said: “It was always going to be difficult for Saido. 
“He knew the reception he would get so was not disappointed. 
“He found it difficult to have an influence but that will come when he gets used to his team-mates.” Reckless West Brom striker Saido Berahino snapchats in motorway fastlane
